What was the Apollo 11 flight like?: The Apollo 11 Moon Landing was a roughly 8-day mission (July 16–24, 1969) that took three astronauts—Neil Armstrong, Buzz Aldrin, and Michael Collins—from Earth to the Moon and back.
Did an emergency happen on the Apollo 11: An emergency did not occur on the Apollo 11 Moon Landing; the mission experienced tense moments during landing but no in-flight accident or life-threatening system failure.
What was the aftermath of the Challenger: The Space Shuttle Challenger disaster concluded that the immediate technical cause was failure of the O-ring seals in a field joint of the right solid rocket booster.
Who was on the Apollo 11 flight?: The crew of the Apollo 11 Moon Landing were Neil Armstrong (commander), Buzz Aldrin (lunar module pilot), and Michael Collins (command module pilot).
What type of rocket did the Apollo 13 us: The Apollo 13 mission was launched using a Saturn V rocket.
